meanings.definition: Practicing strict self-discipline and abstention from indulgence.
meanings.sent1: She led an ascetical life, avoiding all luxuries and focusing on self-control.
meanings.sent2: The ascetical monk lived in a simple cell, eating only plain food and meditating for hours.
meanings.sent3: It was quite ascetical of him to refuse the tempting dessert and stick to his diet.
meanings.sent4: Her ascetical dedication to her studies was like a marathon runner's commitment to training.
meanings.sent5: The ascetical routine of waking up at dawn and exercising felt like a daily challenge.

meanings.definition: Characterized by rigorous self-denial or self-discipline.
meanings.sent1: The ascetical athlete trained tirelessly, pushing himself to the limit every day.
meanings.sent2: His ascetical lifestyle included waking up early, exercising rigorously, and avoiding distractions.
meanings.sent3: It seemed almost ascetical how he refused to take breaks during his intense work sessions.
meanings.sent4: The ascetical dedication of the artist to perfecting every detail was truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: Her ascetical approach to time management made her incredibly efficient and focused.
